alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Kandiyohi; Lac Qui Parle; Swift; Yellow Medicine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 03 at 2:45PM CDT until April 05 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...COMPLEX PROLONGED WINTER STORM TO BRING MULTIPLE PRECIPITATION TYPES AND BLOWING SNOW ACROSS PORTIONS OF WESTERN AND CENTRAL MINNESOTA TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY... .A strengthening weather system will impact the area beginning Tuesday morning in western Minnesota, spreading north and eastwards throughout the day and into Wednesday. Snow will be the initial precipitation type, with snow eventually becoming mixed with sleet, freezing rain, and rain depending on the area. Winds will increase significantly later on Tuesday and into Wednesday, resulting in significant visibility reductions and areas of blowing snow at times, mainly in western Minnesota. Ice accumulations coupled with strengthening winds could also result in falling tree branches or power lines. The Winter Storm Watch has been replaced by a Winter Storm Warning in portions of west-central Minnesota where the combination of falling snow, ice, sleet, and winds will produce the greatest overall impacts to travel and infrastructure. A Winter Weather Advisory has been issued for areas that will see more mixed precipitation and lower overall accumulation, but will still be impacted by the combination of mixed precipitation and winds. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TUESDAY TO 7 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 3 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Lac Qui Parle, Swift, Chippewa, Kandiyohi and Yellow Medicine Counties. * WHEN...From 6 AM Tuesday to 7 AM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.

area.areaDesc: Chippewa; Kandiyohi; Lac Qui Parle; Swift; Yellow Medicine
